description:
I posted an SHO Hubble palette rendition of these data last week. This is a reprocessing of those data with three different NB natural color approaches.

Version A uses a PI Pixel Math formula published by Arturas Medvedevas.

R: iif (Ha>0.15, ha, (Ha*0.8) + (OIII*0.2))
G: iif (Ha>0.5, 1-(1-OIII) * (1-(Ha-0.5)), OIII * (Ha+0.5))
B: iif (OIII>0.1, OIII, (Ha*0.3) + (OIII*0.2))

Version B uses a Pixel Math formula published by Steve Milne.

R: 0.5Ha + 0.5SII
G: 0.15Ha + 0.85OIII
B: OIII

Version C use my Pixel Math formula. My version uses linear Ha, SII, OIII channels in Pixel Math and stretches the resulting image with the RGB channels unlinked.

R: SII + (Ha*0.5)
G: (OIII + SII) *2
B: OIII

Finally, I have also include an HOO rendition (Version D) and my original SHO rendition (Version E) for comparison.

What version do you like the best?


UPDATE: Thank you to everyone that spent the time to consider and comment on these various approaches to creating a more natural color look to narrowband emission nebula data. In tallying the result of those analyses and comments I found that there are nearly as many opinions on what works best as there were options offered. I think that this result might be further evidence of the strong, independent thinking of our community of astrophotographers. No herd mentality here at Astrobin. Thank you all.
imaging_telescopes: William Optics FLT 132 Triplet APO f/7
title: Monkey Head Nebula (NGC 2174) - NB Natural Color Study
